On 11 November 2010 14:47, chris2005hi <chrismnu2003@...> wrote:
>
>
> Thanks Wesley! I did convert over to SharpNEAT 2. I noticed there is no longer an option to disable pruning, might you know how to do
> this?


Hi,

It's not in the GUI anymore but you can do it via the experiment
config XML by defining a very high threshold, e.g.

<ComplexityRegulationStrategy>Absolute</ComplexityRegulationStrategy>
<ComplexityThreshold>9999999</ComplexityThreshold>


Alternativaly if you look at experiment initialization code where the
NeatEvolutionAlgorithm class is constructed; In there you'll see a
ComplexityRegulationStrategy being passed in, so one option there is
to pass in the NullComplexityRegulationStrategy, i.e. no regulation of
complexity = complexifying for the entire run.

Hope that helps,

Colin.
